lg.l: Lake of the mountain land, Lake of the mountain land. Whakatipu Waimāori/Lake Wakatipu is a long inland lake, in the south of the South Island, surrounded by mountains including the Kawarau/Remarkables Range. flowing and free,
Mighty the spirit that dwelleth by thee,
And soft is His breath, as onward we glide,
Over thy bosom, most beautiful tide.
Slumbering sweetly! we break thy repose;
White rise the waves as thy waters unclose,
Curling and foaming, upheaving along,
Sweet in their plaint as a lullaby song.

Varied and precious the things Precious … things. Likely a reference to gold discoveries that were made during the 1860s along the Kawarau River, which is the only outflow of Whakatipu Waimāori/Lake Wakatipu. thou dost hold,
Washed from the crypts of these mountains so old
Treasures of ages! that man may not view,
Lie in the depths of thy fathomless blue.
Lovely at dawning, when glassy and cold,
Lovely at sunset, when burnished with gold,
And roseate gleams, of lingering day,
Steal on thee softly, then vanish away.
Lake of the mountain land, troubled and wild,
Sometimes thou art—like a petulant child—
Tossing and swaying, in terrible form,
Uplifting thy voice far over the storm.
Seek’st thou to break through thy barriers strong,
That here, in thy place, have kept thee so long?
Content thee, fair Lake, thus cradled to be,
For good is the Spirit that dwelleth by thee.
Sunbeams stream o’er thee, by strength of His power,
Moonbeams uplit thee at midnight’s still hour;
The “Austral Cross,” Austral Cross. Crux, also known as the Southern Cross, a constellation visible in the Southern Hemisphere. and fair satellites, shine,
And silently watch thee in beauty divine.
Say, my soul, where is that Great Spirit’s throne,
High in the mountains, so silent and lone?
Nay, far in the Heavens, where eye cannot see.
Earth’s but His footstool, most mighty is He.
These grand hoary heights He called into birth,
Waters He gathered, apart from the earth,
At the beginning. Omnipotent still!
All things existent, His glory doth fill.
Farewell, lovely lake! I step to the shore.
May I be better in heart than before,
Adoring His presence wherever I be,
For God is the Spirit that dwelleth by thee.
